project.teaser: "GNSS is amongst the “game-changing” technologies for future digital and automated rail operations, acknowledged in a 2015 report from the European Union Agency for Railways (ERA) on the longer-term perspective for the evolution of the European Rail Traffic Management...
project.objective: "GNSS is amongst the “game-changing” technologies for future digital and automated rail operations, acknowledged in a 2015 report from the European Union Agency for Railways (ERA) on the longer-term perspective for the evolution of the European Rail Traffic Management System (ERTMS) and the EU Parliament in its adopted report on railway safety and signalling from July 2021 also calls for a joint effort towards the introduction of GNSS in ERTMS. Three major railway operators in Europe – DBN, SBB and SNCF – endorse and support the efforts of the EU Parliament and propose a follow-up-project to the ""Certifiable Localization Unit with GNSS in the railway environment” (CLUG) project to demonstrate the technological readiness of the CLUG Localisation On-Board (LOC-OB) System. In CLUG 2.0 (CLUG Demonstration of Readiness for Rail), the system architecture aims to complement the existing European Train Control System (ETCS) odometry system by using GNSS to enable absolute safe train positioning whilst also transforming the way of train localisation is done today by demonstrating a GNSS-based multi-sensor fusion architecture. To ensure that an enhanced on-board localization in ERTMS/ETCS using GNSS is interoperable, the technological readiness of the LOC-OB System shall be demonstrated in CLUG 2.0. To achieve its objectives, the consortium continues the work started in the first CLUG project, by improving the design of the safe functional architecture and validating it against the requirements defined by the operators. Ultimately, all thanks to an improved LOC-OB System for ERTMS, benefits such as increasing the line capacity, reducing headways between trains, reducing expenditure for rail infrastructure rollout can help reduce emissions, and accelerate the adoption of sustainable and smart mobility solutions that revolve around rail. LOC-OB can make rail transport more attractive, enhance the competitiveness of rail for citizens and businesses."
project.title: CLUG Demonstration of Readiness for Rail
project.keywords: EGNSS, EGNOS, Absolute Safe Satellite Positioning, ERTMS, ETCS, TSI, Sensor Fusion, Digital Map, Start of Mission, Track Selectivity, Along the track, IMU, Balice

details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Mobility, Transport Transitions: Advancing Sustainable and Inclusive Mobility

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan (CDEP) for the project
result.description: This report will outline the plan for all the communication, dissemination and exploitation activities envisaged during the life of the project.

result.title: An Integrity Concept for GNSS/INS/Odometry Rail Localisation

details.authors: Carl Milner, Axelle Biale, Nicolas Mendoza Pila, Elisa Gallon, Junesol Song
details.journalTitle: ION GNSS+, The International Technical Meeting of the Satellite Division of The Institute of Navigation, Proceedings of the 37th International Technical Meeting of the Satellite Division of The Institute of Navigation (ION GNSS+ 2024)

result.title: Operational Needs and System Capabilities of Localisation On-Board System
result.description: This report is the output of task 2.1 and defines the high-level needs of IM and RU and the system capabilities of the Localisation On-Board System needed to fulfil those needs.

result.title: CLUG LOC-OB System Context analysis and RAMS Plan
result.description: This report defines RAMS objectives and activities, considering LOC-OB high-level description and operational context.

result.title: Localisation On-Board System Definition and Operational Context
result.description: This report is the output of task 2.3 and contains system boundary, architecture, digital map definition needed for localisation and external interface definition.

result.title: Localisation On-Board System Requirements
result.description: This report is the output of task 2.4 and includes the functional and non-functional requirements (excluding RAMS requirements) needed to be fulfilled by the system to meet the high-level needs of IM and RU towards absolute safe train positioning.

result.title: Start of Mission and Track Selectivity
result.description: This report is the output of task 2.2 and describes the operational scenarios – Start of Mission and track selectivity and the relevant non-functional requirements relating to the operational scenarios collected by the IMs.

result.title: LOC-OB Preliminary Hazard Analysis
result.description: This report identifies hazards, to assess the severity of potential accidents, identify safeguards for reducing the risks.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CLUG 2.0 (CLUG Demonstration of Readiness for Rail)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
